I missed that episode. How did they kill Terrosaur (I
remember them saying the preds could pick him up after
the battle with airrazor and repair him).

--- Abyssian Badass <thecode@...> wrote:
> OOC: Well, they also didn't make Waspinator or
> Terrorsaur into Transmetals, in fact, they killed
> Terrorsaur instead. They also didn't make Airazor
> into a Transmetal, in fact, they cancelled her and
> Tigatron out of the show. Well, at least they made
> them into Transmetal 2's later (Tigerhawk), They did
> a similar thing with Dinobot, even though he didn't
> act anything like the old Dinobot, and his plot was
> kind of cheesy. Scorponok got ripped off no matter
> which way you look at it. And Tankor isn't a
> Transmetal, either. As for the call out attacks,
> thing, that's just something that they do in
> Anime...
> 
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: dewboy30816@... 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Friday, October 26, 2001 4:44 PM
>   Subject: Re: 2
> 
> 
>   But didn't the robots Transform into Robots in
> Gobots. Doug also said 
>   that it was a ripoff of Transformers. And who here
> thinks it was 
>   stupid to make everyone except Rhinox a Transmetal
> (unless you count 
>   Tankor)? Also wasn't stupid the way in Robots in
> Disguise they call 
>   out there attacks (the only problem with the
> show)?
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@y..., Alloran2@a... wrote:
>   > OOC: Once again, no.  Beast Wars is an
> American/Canadian creation, 
>   from 
>   > Mainframe Entertainment. Same thing goes for
> Beast Machines.  Your 
>   cousins 
>   > boyfriend probably mistook Silverbolt for
> someone else since he has 
>   never 
>   > been in command.  Robots in Disguise originated
> in Japan, being the 
>   only 
>   > Japanese Transformers series so far to come to
> our shores. Gobots is 
>   > COMPLETELY UNRELATED to Transformers.  It was a
> rival show and 
>   toyline in the 
>   > 80s, but Transformers was infinitely more
> popular(and better).
